sponsor.partnerMessage: Beth Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: FPL To Kick Of Concert Series
posts.content:
The Fayetteville Public Library is kicking off its Mountain Street Stage concert series next Sunday, June 5. 

  • The series: The first performance will be the local folk band, The Sons of Otis Malone, a quartet that mixes elements of bluegrass with country music. The subsequent events will be June 12, 26, and July 3, 10, and 24. 
  • Listen: The Library will cap the event at 200 persons for the health and safety of the performers and the music-loving community. You will be able to live stream the concert on Facebook Live and watch it after the performance, too! 

For more information about the June 5 event, click HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
And we've made it -- Memorial Day weekend! Here are some things going on in the area:

  • Smell and sip: Take out someone you love to the Art of Wine Festival this weekend. 
  • Shop local: You can never go wrong with an NWA Farmers’ Market!
  • Play ball! Join the Ozark Adaptive Sports Association as they present a free Adaptive Sports Day in Rogers this weekend!
  • Go outside: Here's a list of 10 of the best things to do in the Ozarks. Perfect for Memorial Day Weekend.
  • Strings: The string section of the Artosphere Festival Orchestra is performing on the Ozark Natural Foods patio from 4-5 this evening. 
  • Motion picture: The Arkansas Public Theatre is screening two 1980s classics on Saturday. 
  • Breathe: Attend an art and yoga retreat this weekend at Mount Sequoyah! 
  • Jam out: CACHE Studios is hosting a “dramatic night of transformation” packed with brand new music on Saturday!
  • Stages everywhere: There’s no music rest for the Memorial holiday weekend in NWA! Go find some more great tunes!

As always, have fun, be safe, and we'll see you next week!

posts.title: Investment Program To Propel NWA Tech Industry
posts.content:
A first-of-its-kind investing program will help educate new investors and support early-stage startups in Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Neighborly support: Angel investments currently represent 90% of outside equity raised by startups after friends and family. With that in mind, Atento Capital, a Tulsa-based venture capital firm, launched 412 Angels. This program will be conducive to attracting more high net-worth individuals to invest in and contribute to the success and growth of startups in the region. 
  • Becoming global leaders: Atento Capital will partner with the Northwest Arkansas Council, the George Kaiser Family Foundation, and the Walton Family Foundation and make a significant step in the momentum of Tulsa and NWA’s collective quest to build one of the most competitive tech economies in the country. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Flying Cars Coming To Bentonville
posts.content:
Do you know where your flying car is? We do. 

  • Join the fun: UP.Partners is hosting UP.Summit 2022, a family-friendly community day at Thaden Field on Sunday, June 5, from 12-4p to look at next-generation vehicles and interactive technology demonstrations. There will be flyover presentations among other awe-inspiring activities.
  • Into the future: There will be food available for purchase from Louise, the in-house cafe, during the showcase of futuristic technology like flying cars, excavators, drones, jet packs, autonomous and electric planes, trucks, cars, and much more. 

Learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Top tier: Accelerate your career with the Walton MBA program, ranked #11 best return on investment out of 600 MBA programs.*
  • Shift: The LIVE! at Turnbow concert was rescheduled for Sunday due to weather.
  • Future leaders: Crystal Bridges recently received a $10 million endowment for its interns.
  • Go see: The new Bella Vista fire station is hosting an open house today.
  • Drink: Bentonville Brewing is releasing a new IPA very soon!
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
